item.title: Vyvx and Genesis Offer Worldwide Video Transport
item.description:
The Power of Fiber for Video Transport Those working in video production, distribution, news, or sports broadcasting need reliable video transport. While satellites have been the traditional choice, fiber optic networks offer compelling advantages, including vast bandwidth, minimal latency, and accessibility in popular locations. The Level 3 and Global Crossing merger brought together their video transport expertise, resulting in a comprehensive range of services. Level 3’s Emmy Award-winning Vyvx service provides broadcast fiber services, managed video networks, teleport and satellite services, and venue-specific services...

item.title: Global Crossing Ups Ante On Network Security
item.description:

Frequent news reports reveal compromised user accounts and credit card information, highlighting the immediate financial burden of these breaches. However, the long-term damage to customer trust and potential loss of business can be even more costly. Beyond these publicized incidents, espionage and intellectual property theft occur discreetly, posing a severe threat to businesses. item.title: EtherSphere Spans The World With Ethernet
item.description:
Global Crossing, through its EtherSphere solutions, provides standardized Carrier Ethernet services globally, offering a centralized network solution for multinational companies with dispersed operations. EtherSphere offers various standardized Ethernet services defined by the Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF). These services include Point-to-Point Ethernet Private Line (EPL) or E-Line, multipoint connections like Ethernet Virtual Private Line (EVPL), Point-to-Multipoint or E-Tree, and Multipoint-to-Multipoint Ethernet Private LAN or VPLS (Virtual Private LAN Service) E-LAN. This range of Ethernet services caters to diverse connectivity needs for interconnecting multiple locations...
